abstracts.cdata!:
The National Environmental Policy Reform
            Project's objective is to establish the basis for
            improved environmental management by defining environmental
            policy reforms and elaborating a National Environmental
            Management Program (NEMP) through a learning and
            participatory process. There are three components in this
            project. First, supporting policy and institutional reform
            will define priority legal, institutional, and fiscal
            reforms to improve environmental management, define sectoral
            action plans for environmental management reform, and
            develop a NEMP. Second, developing pilot activities will
            develop innovative models for natural resource management,
            and increase decentralization of environmental functions.
            The third component, aiming at building capacity for project
            management and providing technical training, will strengthen
            capacity for environmental planning and management in key
            environmental agencies; ensure efficient and effective
            project implementation; and develop the needed human
            resources for the new institutional arrangements resulting
            from the reforms.
